propertiesClass.name: testimonials

components.templateData:
Consultor칤as que maximizan tu impacto

Grupo EMPATIC es una consultora de impacto social que ofrece soluciones estrat칠gicas, tecnol칩gicas y sostenibles para transformar realidades.

Nuestra Metodolog칤a

  • Fase 1
    Diagn칩stico Estrat칠gico

    Analizamos a profundidad el contexto y las necesidades para identificar las oportunidades de mayor impacto.

    • 游댌 Evaluar la empresa o proyecto
    • 游늵 Identificar oportunidades y desaf칤os
    • 游늷 An치lisis de datos y tendencias
  • Fase 2
    Plan de Acci칩n Personalizado

    Dise침amos soluciones a medida, integrando tecnolog칤a, sostenibilidad y enfoque humano.

    • 游닇 Dise침o de estrategias
    • 游늰 Planificaci칩n de la implementaci칩n
    • 游꿢 Definici칩n de KPIs
  • Fase 3
    Implementaci칩n y Acompa침amiento

    Ejecutamos el plan contigo y monitoreamos los resultados para asegurar la sostenibilidad del 칠xito.

    • 游 Ejecuci칩n del plan
    • 游늳 Monitoreo y evaluaci칩n
    • 游댃 Ajustes y optimizaci칩n

Nuestros Valores

Empat칤a

Ponemos a las personas en el centro de cada decisi칩n.

Innovaci칩n

Buscamos soluciones creativas para problemas complejos.

Sostenibilidad

Generamos impacto positivo a largo plazo.

Colaboraci칩n

Creemos en el poder de trabajar juntos.

Lo que dicen de nosotros

components.name: PageComponent
components.template:
Pages in Storybook

We recommend building UIs with a component-driven process starting with atomic components and ending with pages.

Render pages with mock data. This makes it easy to build and review page states without needing to navigate to them in your app. Here are some handy patterns for managing page data in Storybook:

  • Use a higher-level connected component. Storybook helps you compose such data from the "args" of child component stories
  • Assemble data in the page component from your services. You can mock these services out using Storybook.

Get a guided tutorial on component-driven development at Storybook tutorials . Read more in the docs .

Tip Adjust the width of the canvas with the Viewports addon in the toolbar
components.sourceCode:
import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { CommonModule } from '@angular/common'; import { HeaderComponent } from './header.component'; import type { User } from './user'; @Component({ selector: 'storybook-page', standalone: true, imports: [CommonModule, HeaderComponent], template: `

Pages in Storybook

We recommend building UIs with a component-driven process starting with atomic components and ending with pages.

Render pages with mock data. This makes it easy to build and review page states without needing to navigate to them in your app. Here are some handy patterns for managing page data in Storybook:

  • Use a higher-level connected component. Storybook helps you compose such data from the "args" of child component stories
  • Assemble data in the page component from your services. You can mock these services out using Storybook.

Get a guided tutorial on component-driven development at Storybook tutorials . Read more in the docs .

Tip Adjust the width of the canvas with the Viewports addon in the toolbar
`, styleUrls: ['./page.css'], }) export class PageComponent { user: User | null = null; doLogout() { this.user = null; } doLogin() { this.user = { name: 'Jane Doe' }; } doCreateAccount() { this.user = { name: 'Jane Doe' }; } }
